I think asking that question, "but how do you prove that fact=C2=A0to someo=
ne else?", is the beginning of wisdom here.=C2=A0 And hopefully putting som=
e good minds together will come up with an answer.

I know I haven't faked or doodledaddled with any aud=

Zack


On Fri, Jan 1, 2010 at 11:23 AM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo=
. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 








Everyone has their own assumptions, expecta=
tions, and subjectivity.=C2=A0 Scientists realize this, and that is why the=
y use the scientific method: to control for their own human predispositions=
.

On your advice, I read more of her articles.=C2=A0 The one on EVPS: (htt=
p://www.haunteda mericatours. com/EVP/EVP/) does show her presumptions, and=
 she=C2=A0 presents many of the issues and potentials for "false positives"=
 that I assume all experienced EVP researchers already know of. =C2=A0 But =
she also comments to the claims: "My response to this is=E2=80=A6provide th=
e evidence! "


So that would seem to me she would be open to a well-design=
ed test to "show her the evidence".=C2=A0 So I will contact her, suggest th=
is sort of test, and even suggest that experts from this group would help t=
o design and conduct the test - maybe even Frank - and let you know what sh=
e says.

ything - not assuming the presence or absence of anything paranormal.
=C2=

here before even beginning to=C2=A0test things.

e an either.=C2=A0 Yeah, real scientific!

ber Google-googel- google!!
